key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA channel sees strong fare parity at 62%, but notable 'Not Found' rates of 19% in non-SG markets.
Over 72% of itineraries are cheaper on MSE, with minimal overpricing detected under 1%.
Above 90% of GDS fares exceed direct rates, though typical markups remain below 1%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 62% of itineraries matched direct site fares, maintaining stable price alignment.
OTA N/A frequency touched 19% in non-SG markets, suggesting potential distribution gaps.
44.9% of long-haul itineraries showed higher fares on OTA, representing the largest differential.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Averaged about 13% overall, peaking at 19% in non-SG segments.
Largest share at over 62%, staying fairly steady across dimensions.
Nearly 18% of cases, escalating to 45% on long-haul routes.
Lowest portion at around 7%, showing limited price advantage.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 65% match website fares, with 14% higher on OTA.
45% higher on OTA, indicating premium pricing for extended routes.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Three-fourths match website fares; low OTA N/A at 6%.
48% match, but 19% N/A signals service gaps.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA N/A hits 16%; about 60% of fares match directly.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 72% of itineraries are priced lower on MSE than the website.
MSE listings exceed website fares in under 1% of cases.
Price parity edges up, reflecting broader alignment with direct fares.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 4% of website fares missing; limited swings week-over-week.
23% of itineraries matched, showing a modest uptick.
Under 1% of MSE fares exceed direct site.
Majority at over 72%, although slightly easing from previous levels.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 73% are cheaper on MSE, showing consistent discounts.
About 69% remain lower on MSE, though slightly below short-haul levels.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 84% of fares cheaper on MSE, indicating strong competitiveness.
61% see MSE discounts, a moderate share.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 70% of bookings lean cheaper on MSE, with little week-over-week change.
79% remain cheaper on MSE, illustrating solid early-booking savings.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 90% of fares were higher on GDS, but the gap remained under 1%.
Less than 1% of itineraries came in cheaper, mostly short-haul and close-in.
Price differences shifted about 0.16% from last week, suggesting stable trends.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 4–10% of website fares missing on GDS, highest in close-in bookings.
Under 0.01% match website fares, indicating negligible alignment.
Under 1% of itineraries saw cheaper GDS fares.
Above 90% were GDS-higher, with markups near 0.6% last week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 92% higher on GDS; markups average around 0.7%.
96% exceed website rates, though differences hover at 0.45%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 92% GDS-higher; markdowns found in under 0.5% of cases.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 90% higher on GDS; rare price cuts stay under 0.4%.
All priced higher on GDS, but markups remain below 1%.
